channel.title: Hvaing problems with java
channel.description:
~if this is in the wrong section i am very sorry plz remove.~
i am new at all this server stuff and i need help.
almost all the server i download with compliers, i can not play.
when i open it up and pres [r] [enter], or [run] [enter] it tells me unable to find java, or java is not installed.
java is installed and i have the newest version and the right version.
my computer is a vista does that have anything to do with it?
can any one help or give me a link to a tut for my problem
ty
~chiz95

[quote=“pwnedurmom, post:4, topic:216582”][quote author=b e z e r k link=topic=284703.msg2307235#msg2307235 date=1214895570]
Add CLASSPATH and PATH
and if that dont help try getting a diffreent compiler
[/quote]
isn’t that what he just said…?
lawl

and if that classpath and path doesn’t work delete all java previous installed and re-install it, sometimes even when its fully installed and fully working it won’t run.
-SHIT happens =s[/quote]

thank you lol hate when people repost what i say. If you need a compiler i also have one.

item.title: Hvaing problems with java
item.dc:creator: @Rayne Rayne
item.description:
@Rayne wrote:

set up the classpaths…

Not leeched excerpt from my old tut.

First go to control panel>system>advanced options>enviormental variables. Here it will show user variables and system variables. Do not mess with the system variables. First in the user variables create a new user variable and name it CLASSPATH. For the variable value add this - CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%
Next create another user variable and name it PATH. For the variable value add this - C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin
By doing this you are letting your compiler know where to search for the java.

Also in your compiler it may look like /jdk.1.0_5 <–needs to be a 6.

Read full topic
